slide.title: Debugging a core dump
slide.blurb: Make sure you have one first:

div.example: derick@whisky:~/docs/debugging-demo $ *ulimit -c 80000* derick@whisky:~/docs/debugging-demo $ php gdb1/bug01180.php Segmentation fault *(core dumped)*

Core was generated by `php gdb1/bug01180.php'. Program terminated with signal *SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.* #0 __strcmp_sse2_unaligned () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/strcmp-sse2-unaligned.S:32 32 ../sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/strcmp-sse2-unaligned.S: No such file or directory. *(gdb)*

div.blurb: *The binary needs to match the core dump*
